Package io.artframework

Interface FutureResult

  • All Superinterfaces:
    CombinedResult, Result
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultFutureResult
    public interface FutureResult
extends CombinedResult
    The future result is used in situations where the underlying actions or trigger do not immediately return all of their results. This may be the case if an action or trigger is delayed or executed in parallel.

    Use the onCompletion(Consumer) method to subscribe to the future and get notified once the result is completed. You can also use this method even if the result is already completed and will get and immediate callback.

    You also have all of the available options from a normal CombinedResult and can check the intermediate state of this result with the normal methods. This will always only reflect the point in time were this future result was created. It will never reflect the state in between the creation and completion of the future result.

      Combines this future result with the given result.

    • Method Detail

      • empty

        static FutureResult empty()
        Creates a new uncompleted future result.
        Returns:
        a new empty future result

      • of

        static FutureResult of​(CombinedResult result)
        Creates a new future result with the given result as starting point.
        Parameters:
        result - the result to create this future result with
        Returns:
        a new future result

      • of

        static FutureResult of​(Result result)
        Creates a new future result from the given result.
        Parameters:
        result - the result to create this future result with
        Returns:
        a new future result

      • isComplete

        boolean isComplete()
        Checks if this future result is complete. This means that onCompletion(Consumer) has been called and the execution is finished.
        Returns:
        false if the result is incomplete and waits for the rest of the results

      • onCompletion

        void onCompletion​(java.util.function.Consumer<CombinedResult> result)
        Use this callback to react to the completion of this future result. It will be called once the result is complete or immediately if the result is already complete.
        Parameters:
        result - the callback that consumes the final result

      • complete

        FutureResult complete()
        Completes this future result without combining it with another result.

        Use the alternate complete(Result) method to complete this result with another result.

        Returns:
        the completed result

      • complete

        FutureResult complete​(Result futureResult)
        Completes this future result and combines the current result with the results from the future.
        Parameters:
        futureResult - the future result that should be combined with this result and returned to the callback.
        Returns:
        the combined result from the future and present

      • consumers

        java.util.Collection<java.util.function.Consumer<CombinedResult>> consumers()
        Gets a list of all subscribed callbacks of this future result. The list is immutable and must not be changed.
        Returns:
        an immutable list of all callbacks

      • combine

        FutureResult combine​(Result result)
        Combines this future result with the given result. The consumers of both results will be combined if the given result is also a future result. Will return a new future result and leave this result unmodified.
        Specified by:
        combine in interface Result
        Parameters:
        result - the result to combine with this result
        Returns:
        a new future result with combined consumers
